review_title: Works with G920, RX 580, and Air Link
one_reviews_text:
At the time of writing (May 2021), the Logitech G920 force-feedback wheel works perfectly. For a quick run-down as to how this wheel works: by-default it's a Xbox One wheel. When you connect it to a PC, it starts in Xbox mode. You need Logitech's driver (newer G HUB or older Gaming Software) installed and running on your PC, and if it is, it will switch the wheel to PC mode upon plugging it in. Your wheel needs to be in PC mode in order for games (and Project CARS) to detect it.

I use the lowest settings with a RX 580 and Quest 2 (90Hz at 1.0x render resolution). Maintains 90 FPS most of the time. Normally use wired Link, but surprisingly Air Link works fantastic.

There's also command-line arguments available, but in order to use them with the Oculus version, you need to create a shortcut, add the options, and launch PCARS from that shortcut. Some useful ones are -dx11mt -vrnomirror -skipcrowds -pthreads 4.

review_title: Its Good with the right supplies
one_reviews_text:
So I got this game while it was on sale for $7. I read about how it sucks because no one had an xbox controller. And having played it now, I see the frustration. However, I am the owner of both an xbox and a wheel. And I have to say, if you have a wheel, BUY THIS GAME! It enhances it so much and makes it so much more realistic. HOWEVER If you have a weak stomach or don't have a xbox controller, this game isn't for you.

Edit: I also saw some stuff on how the physics suck, Its the first project cars game, cut them some slack

I'm a vr noob but lifetime gamer and I have to say this game actually surprised me. I wasn't expecting my pc to run it on quest 2 link but boy this game is so realistic in vr. If you've got a good spec pc the opposition's cars draw distance would look better but this game looks and feels like your on the road in a real car. There are a few basic scaling tweaks you can do in game to make it feel more to scale even though it's pretty much perfect out of the box. Works well with the Xbox one controller and after a short time of adjustment you realy forget your in a game at all. It's the closest I've come to driving a car without driving a car and I've played all the top driving games over the years. Vr and this game beats the lot. The only thing that would make this more real is a steering wheel set up and haptic feedback. For the price tag you would be nuts not to get this.
I'm using quest2 link 1050ti i7 3series  16gb ram and it runs fine appart from the other cars on the road look basic after about 15 yards draw distance. But that doesn't realy take anything away from the natural realism or experience that this game offers. I can live with that small compromise on my low end pc. Otherwise it's perfect. You can tell they put a lot of effort into building this game.

review_title: The best VR Game for racing wheel so far
one_reviews_text:
The game is a great simulator and if you have a racing wheel it runs like a dream! Checking your side mirrors when force-feedback does it best to get you even more immersed - unforgettable. Here is a comment from my friend when asking him how is it while being immersed - "it's real!".  Got it running with no issues on Rift and Quest via Link. Runs on pretty much most of the hardware (GTX 1070/ I7 16GB RAM laptop it literally flies - I figured that with a bit of a trick you can even get it running with 1050ti ). If you find your pedals not working etc. make sure you have your (Logitech or other) software installed and configured well, then make sure that relevant supported version of the wheel is selected in the configuration of the game. Finally check the calibration etc. It may take a while but when you get it all right, it is awesome.
I saw that game got some unflattering reviews - this game is a simulator and you definitely need a wheel to appreciate it. It is certainly not a NEED FOR SPEED type of a game so it may not suit everybody. Let's see if EA wakes up and delivers some Hot Pursuit VR to the broader audience here.

review_title: Very fun but doesn't always work.
one_reviews_text:
TLDR-great game, tough to get to work sometime.

Gameplay 10/10, 5 stars and all that. When it works, it is absurdly fun, with good mechanics and plenty of great cars and tracks to choose, fun, as well as pretty good graphics. My complaint is that setting up my wheel was a pain because I had to calibrate every single bind for the wheel, and sometimes the game won't run, and the UI isn't incredible. That being said, if you're willing to work with it a bit, and like racing, this game is a good one.

review_title: Are we going to see Project Cars 2?
one_reviews_text: Would love to see Project Cars 2 come to Oculus Rift and also Quest!!!!

Read the reviews and was a bit worried that I would suffer some issues, I did but none that couldnt be fixed.
Spactacular scenery, detailed tracks a totally imersive game.
Problems
1. Menus at 90 degrees to view angle, reset the app view fixed in 2min.
2. Menu navigation, lift the headset go to options and set the VR crosshair delay to select by looking at the option.
3. This is my most anoying issue, Logitech G920 pedals reversed, this took some experimenting but I found the solution in the contoller options, the game correctly I dentifies the G920 and loads the profile, no matter how I fiddled with this and the Logitech profiles in LGS 9.02 I couldnt find the right combo, in desperation I changed to the Logitech Force feedback Pro profile and bingo pedals in the right places all the other controls worked just as if it was the G920 problem solved and onto the game.

My first impression was WOW! I've been playing Dirt Rally VR and PCars is so much better for a lesser skilled driver, more forgiving when you get it wrong.

Setup is : WIN 10
MSI Gaming 7 MB
i5 4670K CPU
ASUS  GTX1060 GFX
32Gb Corsair Vengence RAM

No issues with stuttering, view distance or heat.  It tok less than an hour to get the problems described above resolvedwhich if I compare to the grief of setting up my X-55 controllers in Elite Dangerous, its trivial.

So dont be put off by the bad reviews there is plenty of info on how to resolve the anonying issues, give it a go, everytime I get a new VR game it needs some TLC before I get the best from it.

I have zero regrets for purchasing and thank the design team for this excellent VR racing sim.
Playing with a G27, one of the best racing sims I've ever seen, an amazing VR experience. Career mode is so much fun, starting out on the crazy fast go-karts.

review_title: Really not realistic and hard to play
one_reviews_text:
First I'd like to say I recently boughr a T150 thrusmaster setup with all the kit, I've been playing Dirt Rally a lots since I got it and I decided I wanted to play something else then AC or Dirt, so I bought this, wow what a horrible job on the gameplay even after setting all the configuration, the deadzone the FFB way to F up in this game, I was finally able to play it right and it took me like 2 hours to get somthing that work fine.

But the worst part in that is the fact the it feels like rolling on ice that's clearly stupid, there's just no way to finish a freaking race without a crash at least one time because if you lose your grip there's no way to get it back LOL.

Anw for me it was just a bunch of non sense and waste of money, maybe if you're playing with an xbox controller it's better but still except the weather that's amazing you got a really bad arcade style like game and I would like if I can to be reimburse.

Sorry for my grammar english is not my first language.

Coming from someone will not much interest in cars, but played many Forza and Need for Speed titles amongst other games. (Beam.ng and Project cars etc.) --This is a stellar VR experience to sit down and enjoy.  It isn't too punishing for beginners and makes for a great experiene even if you lack a whole racing wheel setup.  Personally wish there was Oculus Touch support but overall everything ran fine on a 1080 and 4770k setup.  Just figured I'd throw a review in here that was positive after seeing some people saying to stray away from the game bcz of the inability to start the thing... (There is a refund policy if things don't work for you personally).  **Only gripe I have** There probably is replayability here, with the vast amount of tracks selectable, cars, a multiplayer and career mode present, but for some reason I found myself playing it for two days and then putting it down.  Maybe racing sims just aren't for me, but I feel as though other games have held my attention much longer.  Thinking back to the hours spent just roaming on Need for Speed on the PS Vita or hopping into impromtu races on Forza and other titles, customizing and unlocking new parts for my cars, finding secrets around the world..  This is a much more grounded and realistic game, and in THAT way, I felt like there was just not much to do.
In detalls there is italian language, but my game is olny english!
I am really dissappointed that this game does not provide support for the Oculus Rift touch controllers. The graphics look great, but it is unplayable.
i have been with Iracing for 3 years  so have just downloaded project cars i will leave my opinion when i have given project cars a good testing.

VR racing rocks! You don't have to have a wheel. I am using an xbox one game controller quite successfully. You do have to reduce the controller sensitivities  which smooths out the analog sticks. I use both analog sticks for steering and throttle/brakes. There are extra DLC packs available. When will we see them for purchase at the Oculus store?

One of the best examples of the power of VR. you are IN that car and its really a blast to be screaming down those tracks, of which there is a tons of variety seriously, the sun effects on the road and the lens flare really is beautiful. 
only gripe.....I wish these games would allow for a total straight track....even if unrealistic, they give you these cars and great graphics but its kind of a drag after awhile to have to constantly turn and ruin the groove...man, I just want to open her up fast on a straight away and move around the cars all around me rather than speed, slow down, speed slow down speed slow down! maybe have a straightaway with long slow turns rather than sharp.
good fun runs great on my pc no lag well worth the cash enjoy and with xbox controller all good. just got logitech g920 and stand now we are talking stunning game play .

review_title: Oculus does NOT stand by return policy
one_reviews_text:
I picked up several games over the holidays and when I returned the ones that were awful or just would even install from the Oculus home marketplace I was denied a refund even though I had not even played the game ( or even was able to install it). 

here is how Oculus treats their customers:

Hello,

Thanks for reaching out to us.

After review of your account, we've identified that you have requested a high number of content refunds within a short period of time.

As a result, your account has been flagged for potential abuse of the policy and this refund request has been denied.

For more information on the Content Refund Policy, please visit https://www.oculus.com/legal/rift-content-refund-policy/

If you believe this decision has been reached in error, please let us know.

Thank you,

Oculus Support﻿

I bought this as it was 50% off... stated I needed a Xbox controller... I have one but wasn't prepared to pay £60 for one with a blutooth adapter for Pc.. so got a usb cable instead... not this issue... I pretty crap at racing games and set everything as a newbee... set my settings to ultra crap racing driver with every aid turned on however on a free play auto braking failed.. no assistance at all.  I also suffered great motion sickness from this from all angles... which I don't usually suffer from.. The grahics are good, relative to the cars and tracks, sound is also great... 
I guess this is a horses for courses game, either you love it or your feeling sick.  Looked at options to try and reduce MS but nothing that sticks out.

I don`t understand all this negative feedbacks.... :(
This game is just great in terms of VR graphics, feedback (steering wheel) and driving sensation overall.
If one has motion sickness with this game,  for sure its not the game`s fault. I for one I have non, in neither view options. I enjoy every sec of playing.
Finally a game where you can enjoy VR !

oh.. and I use steering wheels with pedals, I think for this game is a must.

I was trying to use the VR controllers and realized I had to use my keyboard with the VR headset. I actually got pretty bored after playing it for like 10 mins. This should have been a free game in my option.
enjoyed playing

Bought it just last night with it being on offer.
Wow! I love it!  I struggled at first using my keyboard to steer, which is no good at all. You need a steering wheel or joystick at least. I have now managed to get my old CH Products flight yoke to work as a steering wheel & its actually working quite well. I've got all the graphics on full & they are amazing. I do have quite a high spec pc (i7-7700K @ 4.2GHZ & 32GB ram plus GTX1080) but I'm sure you dont need this much power. It's so fluid & stunning.
I admit I havent played too many racing games over the years, but this is certainly the best I've ever seen. The list of tracks available & the cars you can drive is huge.
One track that's sadly not included is Dunsfold Aerodrome (aka Top Gear Track) but that can't be helped apparently. 
After reading someone else's review I changed the weather conditions to heavy rain. WOWWW!  It's so realistic! With the raindrops trickling down my helmet I actually started to feel cold & wet LOL  & as for the large puddles everywhere.. so realistic.
Overall it's a fantastic simulator & the VR experience is second to none. I haven't had any motion sickness unlike some, just sheer enjoyment!

Wow this is a great game, the range of cars and conditions makes it a challenge and the combination of a VR headset and a force feedback wheel is probably as close as you will get without getting on a track. I didn't get any motion sickness, it is intense, but in a frantic wheel spinning throwing it up the inside kind of way.

I don't know why the bad reviews, the game is best driving game i have played in VR , first of all my specs 4790k i7, gtx 1070 32 gigs of DDR3  solid state drive PCI-E, so hardly a top of the line PC, yet I can play on everythign on Ultra, the physics are a bit tricky since I play it in pro with a xbox controller, I have done track days on my motorcycle and raced a bit in cars in canyon roads, but these cars feel unruly , it is easy to lose the tail of the car and once you do (unlike a real car) there is not getting it back, you are going to go into a wall, but after a few hours I have gotten the hang of at least the tamest cars , I recommend the FRS rabbit (Turbo) it is one of the funnest cars to drive since it only has 370 horses so it does not behave too bad, the interior of the cars look great, the roads.. well, oculus suffer with long distance VR , a price to pay until we get high rez VR, i take out a star for noone being online ever...

I have got the pedals and wheel that the game says it works with( it is in the preset settings atleast) and i have set them up as the game says to but when i go into a race and i use my pedals and wheel, nothing happens.

Only if you have been trained to go up in space or fly aircraft well beyond mach 5 do not buy this game. I can do a lot of rating intense games but this is beyond intense it is the double black diamond of ski slopes if it was down mount everest and you were riding a tiger while the earth was splitting in half. It is so ridiculous I could hardly get through a lap and I was so immediatly done. So buy at your own risk...

review_title: joyous if you have a wheel
one_reviews_text: Get a wheel and you will enjoy it

review_title: Of 20 games - Only Sever VR Sickness
one_reviews_text: I knew the risks, but my body betrayed me.  I had such a bad case of VR Sickness following my first two attempts to drive the go-cart around 3-laps, that I broke out into a cold sweat from head to toe and was nauseated for three hours afterwards. I literally tore off my headset off during my 2nd set of 3 laps.  This is the only game that I deeply regret because of the unstable horizon, shaking chassis, and overall experience.  I realize there are some advanced settings in the .INI that I can use to stabilize the horizon, but I'm genuinely afraid to ever launch this particular game again.  I've had better VR experiences on VorpX emulation of non-VR Games.  This is the only purchase that I genuinely regret.  I love racing games.   I don't blame my hardware, because I have a high-end PC (i7-6700k @ 4.4GHz with dual GeForce GTX 1080 SLI).  The framerate was not the problem.  I've never had such a violent physiological stress response to anything.  I had sweat poured out of every pore of my body such that it soaked my shirt and pants.  Because of that reaction, I really haven't even put my headset back on for the last two months.   Prior to this, I was playing nightly for 2-3 hours.  I attempted a refund after the 14-day period (because this was such a profoundly sickening experience), but it was rejected.  The graphics were good.  The car control was challenging (even for just the go-carts at training levels).   However, the vibration and horizon made me violently ill.  The closest analogy I can make are some of the migraines that I got when I was younger.  The Migranes would cause intense nausea and vomiting.  After playing, I ended up taking a cold shower and laying down in the dark for three hours. I realize how ridiculous this sounds, but I can’t control how my body responds.  Some reviews warned of this.  I took a chance and lost.

Way better than I was expecting, a true racing VR experience with pretty much no setup issues although if you've not played it before you may find the menu's a little odd, thankfully I havn't experienced any motion sickness just a pure adrenilin rush. Highly recomended especially as it's on sale atm.

I bought Project Cars from the Oculus Store and the game is installed as version 10.0.0.0.1233, how do I update it? This version of the game doesn't keep track of my lap times, the career mode crashes when I pick the class I want to drive and I have no access to multiplayer games.
--EDIT update--
The career mode seems to work now. After doing some research it seems like it is a well know issue that the game does not record any of your lap times ever, somehow it still exists. There's still no multiplayer games shown when I select browse games, maybe no one plays this online anymore?
Pretty awesome game though, buy it if you get a good deal on it. Otherwise save your money for Project Cars II.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GuiwoPAlLlk

Superb VR racing experience that everyone with a VR headset needs to experience! - Enough said.

It is a driving simulator. I played it at one of my friends with a driving seat, and it was awesome, now I own an Oculus, and we're yet to try combining the two of them. First time I tried it with Oculus, it gave me motion sickness straight away, but I realized, you get motion sickness, if the "camera" moves, when your head actually doesn't. So my advice is to everyone, if you're using a VR headset with this game, simply turn off the head movements and reactions in the settings. That greatly reduces the actual cause of the sickness.

I got the game a very very VERY long time ago and have tried everyting to get it to run time and time again, still the game won't start. For the love of god keep your money and spend it on something worthwhile.

I am going to recommend this game to all of my friends who are in to game like this. I think it is a very smooth game (with occasianal bad luck but thats just me) that is very easy to pick up and play a few rounds online or do the campaign. Overall 5/5

support sucks, only uses controller to play.. the menu is displayed on top of everything so you cant see to playt he game correctly.
if they make it so they support the touch controllers ill change this review.
You definitely need a wheel.  If you have one, the Oc Rift VR experience is fantastic!

A lot of complaints about motion sickness. But I don't get any motion sickness. Perhaps I'm a rare case. 

However, I do have other complaints.
There's never an online game available?? WTF is the point in playing a racing sim if not to play against other people? Can't play against other people, useless. 

The option to stare at a specific menu option is available, but you can also use the controller to select menu items. Problem with this is there is way to turn it off that I've found, and I've gone through the menu options one by one hoping to find the option to turn it off. I don't have time to read the information on screen before it selects some random thing that the cross hair happens to be pointed at. 

E-Brake ~ There is an E-Break, but it doesn't break at all. This just means you can rev your engine while stationary or moving, it doesn't hinder movement ~AT ALL~ So no whipping around really tight corners. You're just going to go off track as all it technically does it put you in neutral. I was pointed uphill and used the "E-Brake" but the car started rolling downhill (it could barley be called a "hill") 

Using a controller ~
I have a controller, there is no "slightly turning" it's like their controller settings are designed to fixed degree points. Which forces you to over/understeer. Likely better with a steering wheel, but I already spent the money on the game and wanted to make sure that I liked the game before investing the money into a steering wheel. 

This game doesn't feel like a simulation to me, more like a cockpit viewed racing game (other view options are available) with a VR headset that lets you look around. I in no way feel like I'm actually there. Random "bump" noises when traveling at low speeds while easing on the throttle. I would rather play The Crew on PS4 as a simulator than this. 

Totally not worth the investment, specifically without the online races being available.

This game has been ported to Oculus. And it suck$. Going throug menu (which you see as screen in front of you) is pain in the a$$. You must stare at one piont for three seconds keeping crosschair at manu item. But sometimes crosschair disapears. So you shake your head hoping that it will bring him back. Another problem is support for steering wheel. I've got Logitech G29 which should be OK. But it's not. Sometimes it works OK but mostly it's configuration becomes random. You go through all the pain with menu just to find out that you car starts going backwards at full speed at no reason. Or it doesn't going anywhere despite your efforts with steering wheel and pedals. If you thinking about buing Project Cars knock your head on your desk and buy Asseto.

First let me say that this game is car SIMULATION. Now, the graphics of the game are the best i have seen in VR especially with rain effect witch is just UNBELIEVABLE! You should buy the game just for the weather effects, seriously. Obviously the game cant be played for long since you get motion sickness because of the... guess what, motion. Still one of the best games on my collection

review_title: very bad VR adaption of a great game
one_reviews_text: Only Gaze control on the menu, no support of touch controllers, etc., etc.

I was expecting a simulated driving experiance but this is a race simulator. Sure you can drive nearly uncontrollable cars but it seems to me this game is all about simulating races and race seasons. Fantasy racing league? To me, purchasing this game with the intent to play it, is like playing fantasy football while expecting to actually play football. Very dissapointed in this purchase. If you want a driving simulator, this is not it.

For many years I've driven the amazing SimBin racing titles (realistic, not arcade) and jumped at the opportunity when they offered the Nürburgring. The big deal was how much detail they put into the survey and accuracy.  Well, I just ran through it several times in Project Cars. Amazing. My throttle and braking reflexes carried right over. 

Regarding the VR bit -- I'm really impressed with the font -- it's easily readable, much more so than the fonts in Elite Dangerous.

About control -- I have an Obutto + Logitech G35 sitting next to me but just played with the Oculus and Xbox One controller tonight, still felt amazing.

I think some of the negative reviews might stem from this being closer to a simulator than an arcade racer. You will have to be very touchy with throttle and braking to keep these cars where you want them. This is not Need For Speed.

Thoroughly worth every penny I spent.

I was excited for this game, but it gave an intense motion sickness.  some of the other reviews mention uncontrollable cars, which i also experience (but i also thought maybe i'm just bad at driving games). perhaps that increased the motion sickness as well; incorrect physics?

Few laps at one of my favorites Brands Hatch and was having the best racing experience I've ever had going back to Gran Prix Legends!  Yea the menus are cumbersome but after about 15 minutes had them down.  Sorry for those having problems getting it to run but if you do and you have a good wheel you're in for some fun.

review_title: The worst VR game ever - DO NOT BUY IT!!
one_reviews_text:
Do not under any circumstances buy Project CARS VR.

It is awful, barely functional software.

The control system in VR is awful - look and hold your look at something to basically press A on it. I had an xbox controller and a G25 steeringwheel plugged in - neither of them had any input or control in the menus... so just navigating the thing is awful.

It crashes in the unskippable (yes thats right) intro video 8/10 times.

It disabled keyboard input when you run it in VR... but you have to input your name to start the career... Class A bug. Well done lads!

In the options menu it said the G25 was the default controller... finally managed to get in to a solo race (with an exhuasted neck due to looking at the back button in the top left corner to navigate through menus)... and the G25 had no input... nor did the xbox controller... nor the keyboard.

It also looked horrifically low res in game too.

It is the absolute worst of all VR games I've played. After spending 2 hours getting it working, and figuring out how to navigate the menus... 0/10. VFM: £Dont buy it.

I have read many reviews on this game through the Oculus store, and it definately seems mixed.  I originally downloaded the Pagani free edition from Steam to test this before i bought and it worked well enough.  Once this went on sale as the full version here, I jumped on it.  I run an i7 4790, 32GB RAM, SSD, Nvidia 1070, Windows 10 and a Thrustmaster TMX forcefeedback wheel and pedals(about a 200.00 wheel).  I set the graphics level to medium overall on my first try and everything was smooth, will try to bump that up and see how it goes.  As for controller setup, I had no issue getting things configured, used the included Xbox controller to initially get through the wheel configuration, however if you are going to play with the Xbox controller, you probably shouldn't have to do any extra configuration.  As for some people stating that if you stare to long at one point, yes it will select things, it's not horrible, it's meant for those who just want the ability to look and select with the headset, that's it.  Overall this is a very immersive game (especially if you have a wheel and pedals), and it looks pretty good.  One other nice thing is watching replays in VR, gives a different perspective. As someone who has been gaming for years, it's odd to be able to look around during the replay, but in a good way.  For 26 bucks give or take, this is a really good title, just dont expect it to be an arcade racer, this is more of a serious driving game.  Hope this review helps people out!

They are so lazy they dont even let you use any other controls other than look controls. even if you have a controller it wont turn off so if you are reading things or looking at something too long without pressing buttons randomly on your controller it constantly looks the wrong way. ruins the game makes it play like garbage and if you mess up the controller layout because you are trying to read what everything is set to there is no reset to defaults option. really poor choice on their part. also whereever your head is facing when the game starts is where the game centers the veiw on and if your head is turnned to the left or anything your out of luck because there is no set key to center veiw and in the process of trying to make one you will probably reset every other control while your at it because anything you look at it will click on. the most horrible controller scheme ever. whoever made this you should be ashamed for making a set up so horrible to use.... holy cow.

Project Cars on the desktop supports SLI. However, this version dosen't use SLI. Recently I lost all video to my headset and after trying a number of ideas to get video back... I found that disabling SLI, I have dual 1070s, the video worked again on the headset. I ran project cars and the settings didn't change and the game ran just fine as before. The desktop version I can use SLI and set everything to ultra and it is super smooth. For VR I have to trun down many things and somethings off completely. If it were not for the sense of scale you get with VR, I would be upset that I had to turn things down. Now if they could get a headset that didn't have such a bad screen door effect.

review_title: Don't buy this here, buy it on Steam.
one_reviews_text: You can't play this Oculus version online with everyone else that has this game.  Buy it on Steam.  The Steam version works with Oculus and you can play online with everyone else.  If you buy it here, when you go into multiplayer, you'll be all alone.
I'm not really into circuit racing, but this is a great experience. Well-made and a lot of fun with a steering wheel controller.

Horrible physics, over hyped, clearly bought race driver reviews. I am quite tolerant of poor menus as this is pretty normal in racing sims, few have good ones, hence I have learned to look past them if the sim is good, PCars is not though. Compared to other racing games, I suppose it's ok, but it's not a sim, not even close. If you think it is a good driving sim then you really need to try the likes of Assetto Corsa, rFactor 2, even iRacing if you need to empty your wallet. All work well in VR and are far superior driving/racing sims.
